Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; two groups of three narrow added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of neck, chest and forelegs of bull to right; part of rising triangle and trace of undetermined motif as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Group of Light-Walled Naukratis Animal Chalices. All sherds in this group are small and offer very little by way of information beyond the fact that they come from light-walled chalices. The decoration on sherds belonging to this group is also poorly or carelessly drawn (Lemos 1991, 93).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 93, p. 259, no. 495, pl. 66)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0533) (phase 2)
